Directions: Line unpricked pastry shells with a double thickness of heavy-duty foil. Bake at 450 degrees F for 8 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside; remove foil. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F.

In a saucepan, beat eggs and sugar until thickened, about 2 minutes. Add butter and chocolate chips. Cook over low heat until melted and smooth; stirring constantly. stir in pecans, coconut and vanilla. Pour into pie shells. Cover edges of pastry with foil. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20-25 minutes or until puffed.
Ingredients: 1 cup butter or margarine, cut into 8 pieces
